TITLE: Setting Default Linux Distribution for WSL
DESCRIPTION: This command sets the default Linux distribution to be used with the wsl command. Replace <DistributionName> with the desired distribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/install.md#2025-04-06_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl -s <DistributionName>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing WSL using PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: This command installs WSL with the default Ubuntu distribution. It enables necessary features and requires administrator privileges.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/install.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing WSL with Ubuntu Distribution in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to install WSL with the default Ubuntu distribution. Several options are available including specifying a different distribution, disabling auto-launch, using web download, and enabling WSL1.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing WSL using PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Windows Subsystem for Linux with default Ubuntu distribution. This enables WSL components, installs Linux kernel, sets WSL 2 as default, and installs Ubuntu.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/setup/environment.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring WSL2 Settings in .wslconfig File (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates a sample .wslconfig file with various WSL2 configuration options. It includes settings for memory limits, processors, custom kernel, swap space, networking, and experimental features.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/wsl-config.md#2025-04-06_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Settings apply across all Linux distros running on WSL 2
[wsl2]

# Limits VM memory to use no more than 4 GB, this can be set as whole numbers using GB or MB
memory=4GB 

# Sets the VM to use two virtual processors
processors=2

# Specify a custom Linux kernel to use with your installed distros. The default kernel used can be found at https://github.com/microsoft/WSL2-Linux-Kernel
kernel=C:\\temp\\myCustomKernel

# Specify the modules VHD for the custum Linux kernel to use with your installed distros.
kernelModules=C:\\temp\\modules.vhdx

# Sets additional kernel parameters, in this case enabling older Linux base images such as Centos 6
kernelCommandLine = vsyscall=emulate

# Sets amount of swap storage space to 8GB, default is 25% of available RAM
swap=8GB

# Sets swapfile path location, default is %USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\swap.vhdx
swapfile=C:\\temp\\wsl-swap.vhdx

# Disable page reporting so WSL retains all allocated memory claimed from Windows and releases none back when free
pageReporting=false

# Turn on default connection to bind WSL 2 localhost to Windows localhost. Setting is ignored when networkingMode=mirrored
localhostforwarding=true

# Disables nested virtualization
nestedVirtualization=false

# Turns on output console showing contents of dmesg when opening a WSL 2 distro for debugging
debugConsole=true

# Enable experimental features
[experimental]
sparseVhd=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Installed Linux Distributions with Details in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to display installed Linux distributions along with their state (running or stopped) and WSL version (1 or 2). Additional options include --all, --running, and --quiet.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --list --verbose
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting WSL Version for a Distribution in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to set a specific WSL version (1 or 2) for a Linux distribution. Requires the distribution name and desired version number as parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --set-version <distribution name> <versionNumber>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Configuring PostgreSQL on Ubuntu WSL
DESCRIPTION: Steps for installing PostgreSQL on Ubuntu WSL, including package updates, installation commands, service management, and connecting to the PostgreSQL shell.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/wsl-database.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo apt update
sudo apt install postgresql postgresql-contrib
psql --version
sudo service postgresql status
sudo service postgresql start
sudo service postgresql stop
sudo passwd postgres
sudo -u postgres psql
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating WSL in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to update WSL to the latest version. The --web-download option allows downloading the update from GitHub rather than the Microsoft Store.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --update
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Configuring MySQL on Ubuntu WSL
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing MySQL on Ubuntu WSL, including updating packages, installing MySQL server, checking version, starting the service, and basic database operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/wsl-database.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo apt update
sudo apt install mysql-server
mysql --version
systemctl status mysql
sudo mysql
```

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SHOW DATABASES;
CREATE DATABASE database_name;
DROP DATABASE database_name;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking WSL Status in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to display general information about the WSL configuration, including default distribution type, default distribution, and kernel version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --status
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Default WSL Version in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the default WSL version (1 or 2) for new Linux distribution installations. This setting applies to all future installations until changed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --set-default-version <Version>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring WSL Distribution Settings with wsl.conf
DESCRIPTION: Example wsl.conf file demonstrating various configuration options including automount settings, network configuration, interop settings, user defaults, and boot commands. This file should be placed at /etc/wsl.conf within the WSL distribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/wsl-config.md#2025-04-06_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Automatically mount Windows drive when the distribution is launched
[automount]

# Set to true will automount fixed drives (C:/ or D:/) with DrvFs under the root directory set above. Set to false means drives won't be mounted automatically, but need to be mounted manually or with fstab.
enabled = true

# Sets the directory where fixed drives will be automatically mounted. This example changes the mount location, so your C-drive would be /c, rather than the default /mnt/c. 
root = /

# DrvFs-specific options can be specified.  
options = "metadata,uid=1003,gid=1003,umask=077,fmask=11,case=off"

# Sets the `/etc/fstab` file to be processed when a WSL distribution is launched.
mountFsTab = true

# Network host settings that enable the DNS server used by WSL 2. This example changes the hostname, sets generateHosts to false, preventing WSL from the default behavior of auto-generating /etc/hosts, and sets generateResolvConf to false, preventing WSL from auto-generating /etc/resolv.conf, so that you can create your own (ie. nameserver 1.1.1.1).
[network]
hostname = DemoHost
generateHosts = false
generateResolvConf = false

# Set whether WSL supports interop processes like launching Windows apps and adding path variables. Setting these to false will block the launch of Windows processes and block adding $PATH environment variables.
[interop]
enabled = false
appendWindowsPath = false

# Set the user when launching a distribution with WSL.
[user]
default = DemoUser

# Set a command to run when a new WSL instance launches. This example starts the Docker container service.
[boot]
command = service docker start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Available Linux Distributions for WSL in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to display a list of Linux distributions available through the online store. Can also be entered as 'wsl -l -o'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --list --online
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Docker CLI Commands
DESCRIPTION: A collection of fundamental Docker commands for viewing Docker information, listing images, and managing containers within WSL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/wsl-containers.md#2025-04-06_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker
docker <COMMAND> --help
docker image ls --all
docker container ls --all
docker ps -a
docker info
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling systemd in WSL Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable systemd support in a WSL distribution by adding entries to the wsl.conf file. This makes the WSL environment more similar to traditional Linux systems by enabling the systemd service manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/wsl-config.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
[boot]
systemd=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking WSL Version and Installed Distributions
DESCRIPTION: This command lists installed Linux distributions and their corresponding WSL versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/install.md#2025-04-06_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl -l -v
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling systemd in WSL by editing wsl.conf
DESCRIPTION: Configuration snippet to enable systemd for a Linux distribution in WSL. This requires adding the systemd=true setting under the [boot] section in the /etc/wsl.conf file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/systemd.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
[boot]
systemd=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Windows Subsystem for Linux in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell command enables the Windows Subsystem for Linux optional feature. It should be run as Administrator.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/install-manual.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
dism.exe /online /enable-feature /featurename:Microsoft-Windows-Subsystem-Linux /all /norestart
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Default Linux Distribution in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the default Linux distribution that WSL commands will use when no specific distribution is specified. Requires the name of the preferred Linux distribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --set-default <Distribution Name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Virtual Machine Platform in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell command enables the Virtual Machine Platform optional feature, which is required for WSL 2. It should be run as Administrator.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/install-manual.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
dism.exe /online /enable-feature /featurename:VirtualMachinePlatform /all /norestart
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changing to Home Directory in WSL from PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to start WSL in the user's home directory. The tilde (~) shortcut can be used from within WSL to navigate to the home directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl ~
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Using SQLite on Ubuntu WSL
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for installing SQLite on Ubuntu WSL, creating a test database, and performing basic operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/wsl-database.md#2025-04-06_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo apt update
sudo apt install sqlite3
sqlite3 --version
sqlite3 example.db
```

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
.databases
.dbinfo ?DB?
CREATE TABLE empty (kol INTEGER);
.exit
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running a Specific Linux Distribution with a Specific User in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to launch a specific Linux distribution with a specific user account. Both the distribution name and user name must be valid, existing values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --distribution <Distribution Name> --user <User Name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking WSL Distribution Version in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to check which WSL version (1 or 2) your Linux distributions are running. Used to verify that distributions are using WSL 2 mode which is required for Docker Desktop integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/wsl-containers.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl -l -v
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking WSL Version in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to display version information about WSL and its components. Provides detailed version numbers for the WSL subsystem.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Git on Ubuntu/Debian in WSL
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the latest stable Git version on Ubuntu or Debian distributions through apt package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/wsl-git.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo apt-get install git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying WSL Help Information in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to display a list of available options and commands for WSL. Provides a quick reference for WSL command syntax and options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Port Forwarding for WSL2 Network Access
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell command uses Netsh to set up port forwarding, allowing access to WSL2 applications from the local area network. It forwards a specified port from the host to the WSL2 VM's IP address.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/networking.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
netsh interface portproxy add v4tov4 listenport=<yourPortToForward> listenaddress=0.0.0.0 connectport=<yourPortToConnectToInWSL> connectaddress=(wsl hostname -I)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changing Default User for a WSL Distribution in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to change the default user for a specific WSL distribution. The specified user must already exist inside the distribution to become the default user.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
<DistributionName> config --default-user <Username>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Specific Linux Distribution for WSL
DESCRIPTION: This command installs a specific Linux distribution. Replace <Distribution Name> with the desired distribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/install.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --install -d <Distribution Name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Terminating a Specific WSL Distribution in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to terminate or stop a specific WSL distribution from running. Requires the name of the targeted distribution as a parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --terminate <Distribution Name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Shutting Down All WSL Distributions in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to immediately terminate all running distributions and the WSL 2 lightweight utility virtual machine. Useful when needing to restart the WSL 2 VM environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --shutdown
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exporting a WSL Distribution in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to export a snapshot of a specified distribution as a new distribution file. Defaults to tar format, but can also export as a .vhdx file with the --vhd option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --export <Distribution Name> <FileName>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Directory Contents
DESCRIPTION: Display the contents of the current directory using the ls command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/linux.md#2025-04-06_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ls
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing a WSL Distribution in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to import a tar file as a new WSL distribution. Options include specifying a .vhdx file instead and choosing between WSL 1 and WSL 2 for the imported distribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --import <Distribution Name> <InstallLocation> <FileName>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Directory Contents with Details
DESCRIPTION: Display detailed information about directory contents, including permissions and modification times.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/linux.md#2025-04-06_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ls -l
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing a WSL Distribution In-Place in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Command to import a .vhdx file as a new WSL distribution. The virtual hard disk must be formatted with the ext4 filesystem type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --import-in-place <Distribution Name> <FileName>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a New File
DESCRIPTION: Create a new empty file named 'hello_world.txt' using the touch command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/linux.md#2025-04-06_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
touch hello_world.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Mounting Disks in WSL
DESCRIPTION: Command to attach and mount a physical disk in all WSL2 distributions. Supports various options including custom naming, filesystem type specification, and partition selection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --mount <DiskPath>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Editing a File with VS Code
DESCRIPTION: Open the file 'hello_world.txt' for editing in Visual Studio Code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/linux.md#2025-04-06_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
code hello_world.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Unmounting Disks in WSL
DESCRIPTION: Command to unmount a specific disk or all mounted disks in WSL. If no disk path is provided, it unmounts and detaches all mounted disks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/basic-commands.md#2025-04-06_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --unmount <DiskPath>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying File Contents
DESCRIPTION: View the contents of the file 'hello_world.txt' in the terminal using the cat command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/linux.md#2025-04-06_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat hello_world.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sorting File Contents
DESCRIPTION: Display the sorted contents of the file 'fruits.txt' using cat and sort commands with a pipe.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/linux.md#2025-04-06_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat fruits.txt | sort
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Searching File Contents
DESCRIPTION: Search for lines containing 'P' in the file 'fruits.txt' using cat and grep commands with a pipe.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/linux.md#2025-04-06_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat fruits.txt | grep P
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sorting and Saving File Contents
DESCRIPTION: Sort the contents of 'fruits.txt' and save the result to a new file 'sorted_fruit.txt'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/tutorials/linux.md#2025-04-06_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat fruits.txt | sort > sorted_fruit.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Locating a WSL Distribution's VHDX File Path
DESCRIPTION: PowerShell script to find the path to a specific Linux distribution's ext4.vhdx file by querying the Windows registry. This path is needed for mounting and repairing the distribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/disk-space.md#2025-04-06_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
(Get-ChildItem -Path HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Lxss | Where-Object { $_.GetValue("DistributionName") -eq '<distribution-name>' }).GetValue("BasePath") + "\ext4.vhdx"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Repairing a WSL Distribution's File System
DESCRIPTION: Command to repair a WSL distribution's ext4 file system using the e2fsck utility. This checks for and fixes errors in the file system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/disk-space.md#2025-04-06_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl.exe sudo e2fsck -f /dev/<device>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Mounting a WSL Distribution VHD File for Repair
DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to mount a WSL distribution's VHD file for repair purposes. The path to the ext4.vhdx file must be specified.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/disk-space.md#2025-04-06_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl.exe --mount <path-to-ext4.vhdx> --vhd --bare
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Shutting Down All WSL Distributions
DESCRIPTION: PowerShell command to shut down all running WSL distributions. This is a necessary step before attempting to repair a distribution with a disk mount error.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/disk-space.md#2025-04-06_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl.exe --shutdown
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: File System Write Error in Read-only WSL Distribution
DESCRIPTION: Error message that appears when attempting to write to a filesystem in a WSL distribution that has been mounted as read-only.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/disk-space.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ touch file
touch: cannot touch 'file': Read-only file system
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Read-only Fallback Error Message in WSL
DESCRIPTION: Error message displayed when WSL encounters a mounting error and sets the distribution to read-only mode as a fallback mechanism.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/disk-space.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
An error occurred mounting the distribution disk, it was mounted read-only as a fallback.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Block Device Information with lsblk in WSL
DESCRIPTION: Sample output of the lsblk command in WSL, which displays information about all block devices connected to the Linux distribution including their names, sizes, and mount points.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/disk-space.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
NAME MAJ:MIN RM   SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINTS
sda    8:0    0 363.1M  1 disk
sdb    8:16   0     8G  0 disk [SWAP]
sdc    8:32   0   1.5T  0 disk
sdd    8:48   0     1T  0 disk /mnt/wslg/distro
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling Case Sensitivity for WSL Mounted Drive
DESCRIPTION: This bash command disables case-sensitivity on a directory of a drive mounted to a WSL distribution, returning it to the case-insensitive default.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/case-sensitivity.md#2025-04-06_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
fsutil.exe file setCaseSensitiveInfo <path> disable
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing USB Devices in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Lists all USB devices connected to Windows using the usbipd command. This helps identify the bus ID of the device you want to connect to WSL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/connect-usb.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
usbipd list
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Case Sensitivity for WSL Mounted Drive
DESCRIPTION: This bash command enables case-sensitivity on a directory of a drive mounted to a WSL distribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/case-sensitivity.md#2025-04-06_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
fsutil.exe file setCaseSensitiveInfo <path> enable
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Binding USB Device for WSL Use
DESCRIPTION: Binds a USB device to make it available for sharing with WSL. This command requires administrator privileges and specifies the bus ID of the device to be shared.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/connect-usb.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
usbipd bind --busid 4-4
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Case Sensitivity in WSL Config File
DESCRIPTION: These bash snippets show different options for configuring case sensitivity in the WSL config file (/etc/wsl.conf) when mounting a drive.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/case-sensitivity.md#2025-04-06_snippet_3

TITLE: Implementing Out-of-Box Experience (OOBE) Script in Bash
DESCRIPTION: A sample bash script for creating the out-of-box experience (OOBE) for the WSL distribution. It prompts the user to create a default UNIX user account with specific settings and permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/build-custom-distro.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
#!/bin/bash

set -ue

DEFAULT_GROUPS='adm,cdrom,sudo,dip,plugdev'
DEFAULT_UID='1000'

echo 'Please create a default UNIX user account. The username does not need to match your Windows username.'
echo 'For more information visit: https://aka.ms/wslusers'

if getent passwd "$DEFAULT_UID" > /dev/null ; then
  echo 'User account already exists, skipping creation'
  exit 0
fi

while true; do

  # Prompt from the username
  read -p 'Enter new UNIX username: ' username

  # Create the user
  if /usr/sbin/adduser --uid "$DEFAULT_UID" --quiet --gecos ''  "$username"; then

    if /usr/sbin/usermod "$username" -aG "$DEFAULT_GROUPS"; then
      break
    else
      /usr/sbin/deluser "$username"
    fi
  fi
done
```

TITLE: Creating and Signing a Test Certificate for WSL Plugins in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Script to create a self-signed certificate for testing WSL plugins, export it to a file, and sign a WSL plugin DLL. This is necessary because WSL plugins require digital signatures to run.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/wsl-plugins.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
# Create the cert
$certname = "WSLPluginTestCert"
$cert = New-SelfSignedCertificate -Subject "CN=$certname" -CertStoreLocation "Cert:\CurrentUser\My" -KeyExportPolicy Exportable -KeySpec Signature -KeyLength 2048 -KeyAlgorithm RSA -HashAlgorithm SHA256 -Type CodeSigningCert

# Export it to a local path
Export-Certificate -Cert $cert -FilePath ".\$certname.cer"

# Sign the DLL file
Set-AuthenticodeSignature -FilePath "C:\dev\Path\To\Your\WSLPlugin.dll" -Certificate $cert
```

TITLE: Overriding WSL Distribution Manifest with PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell script allows testing of a custom distribution tar by overriding the WSL distribution manifest. It creates a local manifest file and sets the necessary registry key to use this file instead of the default manifest.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/build-custom-distro.md#2025-04-06_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
#Requires -RunAsAdministrator

[cmdletbinding(PositionalBinding = $false)]
param (
    [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)][string]$TarPath,
    [string]$Flavor = "test-distro",
    [string]$Version = "test-distro-v1",
    [string]$FriendlyName = "Test distribution version 1")

Set-StrictMode -Version latest

$TarPath = Resolve-Path $TarPath
$hash = (Get-Filehash $TarPath -Algorithm SHA256).Hash


$manifest= @{
    ModernDistributions=@{
        "$Flavor" = @(
            @{
                "Name" = "$Version"
                Default = $true
                FriendlyName = "$FriendlyName"
                Amd64Url = @{
                    Url = "file://$TarPath"
                    Sha256 = "0x$hash"
                }
            })
        }
    }

$manifestFile = "$PSScriptRoot/manifest.json"
$manifest | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5 | Out-File -encoding ascii $manifestFile


Set-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Lxss" -Name DistributionListUrl -Value "file://$manifestFile" -Type String -Force 
```

TITLE: WSL Command Line Usage Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive documentation of wsl.exe command line arguments and options, including distribution management and execution controls.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/release-notes.md#2025-04-06_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage: wsl.exe [Argument] [Options...] [CommandLine]

Arguments to run Linux binaries:

    If no command line is provided, wsl.exe launches the default shell.

    --exec, -e <CommandLine>
        Execute the specified command without using the default Linux shell.

    --
        Pass the remaining command line as is.

Options:
    --distribution, -d <DistributionName>
        Run the specified distribution.

    --user, -u <UserName>
        Run as the specified user.

Arguments to manage Windows Subsystem for Linux:

    --export <DistributionName> <FileName>
        Exports the distribution to a tar file.
        The filename can be - for standard output.

    --import <DistributionName> <InstallLocation> <FileName>
        Imports the specified tar file as a new distribution.
        The filename can be - for standard input.

    --list, -l [Options]
        Lists distributions.

        Options:
            --all
                List all distributions, including distributions that are currently
                being installed or uninstalled.

            --running
                List only distributions that are currently running.

    -setdefault, -s <DistributionName>
        Sets the distribution as the default.

    --terminate, -t <DistributionName>
        Terminates the distribution.

    --unregister <DistributionName>
        Unregisters the distribution.

    --upgrade <DistributionName>
        Upgrades the distribution to the WslFs file system format.

    --help
        Display usage information.
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/filesystems.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
C:\temp> wsl sudo apt-get update
```

TITLE: Mixing Linux and Windows Commands in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Examples of combining Linux and Windows commands in PowerShell using WSL. These commands demonstrate how to use Linux commands to filter output from Windows commands and vice versa.

TITLE: Querying Windows Host IP Address from WSL2
DESCRIPTION: This Bash command retrieves the IP address of the Windows host from within a WSL2 Linux distribution. It uses 'ip route' to show the routing table and extracts the default gateway address.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/networking.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ip route show | grep -i default | awk '{ print $3}'
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/install-on-server.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

CODE:

TITLE: Restarting CentOS WSL Distribution with New Default User
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell snippet demonstrates how to terminate the CentOS WSL instance and restart it to apply the new default user settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/use-custom-distro.md#2025-04-06_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl --terminate CentOS

```

TITLE: Adding Linux Distribution to PATH
DESCRIPTION: PowerShell commands to add the Linux distribution path to the Windows environment PATH variable for the current user.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/install-on-server.md#2025-04-06_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
$userenv = [System.Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable("Path", "User")
[System.Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable("PATH", $userenv + ";C:\Users\Administrator\Ubuntu", "User")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Default User Account in Imported CentOS WSL Distribution
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install necessary tools, create a user account, and set it as the default user in the imported CentOS WSL distribution. It also adds the user to the sudoers file for elevated permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/use-custom-distro.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yum update -y && yum install passwd sudo -y
myUsername=caloewen
adduser -G wheel $myUsername
echo -e "[user]\ndefault=$myUsername" >> /etc/wsl.conf
passwd $myUsername
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Querying Linux Distribution IP Address in Windows
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell command retrieves the IP address of a Linux distribution running in WSL2. It uses the 'wsl' command to execute the 'hostname -I' command within the specified distribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/networking.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wsl -d <DistributionName> hostname -I
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing CentOS Tar File into WSL using PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a directory for storing the WSL distribution and import the CentOS tar file into WSL using PowerShell commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/use-custom-distro.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
cd C:\temp
mkdir E:\wslDistroStorage\CentOS
wsl --import CentOS E:\wslDistroStorage\CentOS .\centos.tar
wsl -l -v
wsl -d CentOS
```

TITLE: Accessing Linux and Windows file systems from PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: These commands show how to access both Linux and Windows file systems using WSL from PowerShell.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/filesystems.md#2025-04-06_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
C:\temp> wsl ls -la /proc/cpuinfo
```

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
C:\temp> wsl ls -la "/mnt/c/Program Files"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exporting CentOS Container to Tar File using Docker in WSL
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to run a CentOS container in Docker, export it as a tar file, and clean up the container. It requires Docker Desktop for Windows with WSL 2 integration enabled.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/use-custom-distro.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -t --name wsl_export centos ls /
docker export wsl_export > /mnt/c/temp/centos.tar
docker rm wsl_export
```

TITLE: Installing systemd packages on Debian-based distributions
DESCRIPTION: Command to update package repositories and install systemd and systemd-sysv packages on Debian/Ubuntu/Kali Rolling distributions, which is required for proper systemd functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/WSL/blob/main/WSL/systemd.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

```
